item.title: Sarm Heslop: Missing woman's parents still have hope
item.description: Four months after she vanished, it is still not known what happened to Sarm Heslop.

item.title: River Dee search: Body found in search for missing boy
item.description: The teenager disappeared after going swimming in the River Dee in Cheshire.

item.title: Marcus Rashford mural messages removed after heavy rain
item.description: Manchester City Council intends to preserve the messages, which were left in support of the England star.

item.title: Covid-19: Great Yarmouth borough has highest rise in 'pings' from app
item.description: Parts of Great Yarmouth borough are already undergoing enhanced testing after a sharp rise in cases.

item.title: London Ambulance Service facing busiest July in history
item.description: Paramedics say the weather and easing of Covid restrictions has led to a surge in calls.

item.title: The DJ who took a nightclub to the streets
item.description: After coronavirus shut the nightclubs he DJs in, SUAT, of Oxted, took his decks on to the streets.

item.title: Tewkesbury man first to swim 47.1 miles of River Avon
item.description: Craig Openshaw fights injury and illness to cover a distance greater than two cross-Channel swims.

item.title: Pilot praises RAF Lakenheath plane spotter for saving his life
item.description: Ian Simpson alerts an airbase after seeing sparks and flames coming from the rear of a jet.

item.title: Dundas Aqueduct repaired by abseiling stonemasons
item.description: Dundas Aqueduct is considered to be one of England's finest examples of Georgian canal engineering.

item.title: Roman treasure returns to Norfolk town where it was found
item.description: The Thetford hoard has been held at the British Museum since its discovery by detectorists in 1979.

item.title: Parkrun: Northampton runner, 88, to jog 400th race as event returns
item.description: Bob Emmerson will become the oldest person to reach the milestone as the event makes a comeback.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Bristol plant blown up in controlled explosion
item.description: About 300kg of explosives was used to bring down the disused building at Avonmouth near Bristol.

item.title: Moeen Ali visits his new portrait in Birmingham park
item.description: The England star captains Birmingham Phoenix in cricket's newest tournament.

item.title: Scarborough beach day trips for Barrowcliff estate children
item.description: A community group has been getting children from Scarborough's Barrowcliff estate to the beach.

item.title: Driver loses police in wrong-way pursuit in High Wycombe
item.description: The van was seen exceeding 90mph along residential streets and was finally stopped a week later.

item.title: Master distiller brings gin back to home town Henley-upon-Thames
item.description: Jacob Wilson overcame illness to set up the first distillery in Henley in 270 years.

item.title: Mick Norcross: Former Towie star took his own life, inquest rules
item.description: Mick Norcross was in danger of losing his home and struggled in lockdown, his inquest hears.

item.title: Croydon tram crash passenger deaths ruled accidental
item.description: Seven people died when the tram tipped over and spun off the track in Croydon in November 2016.

item.title: Pistol: Danny Boyle's Sex Pistols drama filmed in Hemel Hempstead
item.description: The director and his crew transform Hemel Hempstead into gritty urban centres for a punk drama.

item.title: Channel crossings: Hundreds more migrants cross to UK
item.description: The government said a surge in illegal migration across Europe had seen a rise in crossings.

item.title: Tommy Robinson loses Jamal Hijazi libel case
item.description: The High Court orders the anti-Islam activist to pay a teenage refugee Â£100,000 in damages.

item.title: Manchester Arena Inquiry: Bomb victims felt abandoned, says sister
item.description: The families of victims of the 2017 bombing describe the "horrific" aftermath at Manchester Arena.

item.title: West Midlands Police chief calls for Test and Trace exemptions
item.description: The high number of West Midlands Police staff self-isolating is making policing "challenging".

item.title: Women's Super League fixtures: Chelsea begin WSL title defence at Arsenal
item.description: Chelsea will begin their Women's Super League title defence at Arsenal, while Manchester City travel to Everton.

item.title: Johnson-Thompson bids to upset Olympic odds
item.description: How Katarina Johnson-Thompson tore up everything to claim world gold and will have to upset the odds once more to win in Tokyo.

item.title: QPR assistant Eustace set for Swansea job
item.description: Swansea City are poised to appoint John Eustace as their new manager.

item.title: County Championship: Somerset to face Nottinghamshire in Division One opener
item.description: Somerset's bid for a first County Championship title will resume against Nottinghamshire when the second phase of the competition gets under way.

item.title: Son Heung-min: Tottenham forward signs new four-year contract
item.description: Tottenham forward Son Heung-min signs a new four-year contract keeping him at the club until 2025.
